title: A Week In The Life, Vol 29.

author: Jessica
excerpt: What a week!! So much happened this week that I don’t even know how it’s only been seven days. Morning workouts with this baby! I woke up super early Monday morning (errr… basically didn’t even sleep) to our flight to Nantucket being delayed. Made it to the airport while resulted in a very hellish 36 […]
text: What a week!! So much happened this week that I don’t even know how it’s only been seven days. Morning workouts with this baby! I woke up super early Monday morning (errr… basically didn’t even sleep) to our flight to Nantucket being delayed. Made it to the airport while resulted in a very hellish 36 hours. We made it to NYC where we then couldn’t leave. Flew to Boston in the middle of the night to be closer to the island… and eventually landed on Tuesday afternoon! I have never left the three of them and it was VERY HARD!! It was so hard on all of us! Max sent me a text that said it was “the longest day of his life.” Hated being away from them! Our luggage didn’t arrive on Nantucket when we did. So lunch it was! The Cru lobster roll has been one of my favorite lobster rolls since 2013 when I first had it. Everything else is delish too! I am team warm lobster roll every day. All worth it! Praise that our luggage showed up at the actual 11th hour before the book event! White Elephant at night is dreamy. We had so many delicious meals! Starting at The Nautilus. Just as dreamy in real life. It has been AGES since I had a smoothie bowl but this was so good… probably because it was steamy as heck with 1% humidity! This signing was amazing… Elin’s fans are incredible and line up for hours ahead of time. Dinner later was wok fried lobster! Ahhhh. I adore Nantucket because it is just so charming. I have forever. If only it didn’t cost a bajillion dollars to live there! My suitcase got the memo to match the hydrangeas. It’s the BEIS berry. After no sleep for almost 48 hours to start the trip, it was hard to recover. We had a great time but I still can’t get over that we lost an entire 1.5 days, our place for the night and all of our plans! Needless to say I was excited to get home. Favorite preschooler in his 90s gear. Matching for cross country! So fun. And a little walk in the sun later that evening. Had to make a good dinner today! All the caramelized onions. Classic summer love. My lettuce wrap burgers, roasted broccoli, caprese and chive grilled potatoes! Yum yum.
html:
What a week!!

So much happened this week that I don’t even know how it’s only been seven days.

Morning workouts with this baby!

I woke up super early Monday morning (errr… basically didn’t even sleep) to our flight to Nantucket being delayed. Made it to the airport while resulted in a very hellish 36 hours.

We made it to NYC where we then couldn’t leave. Flew to Boston in the middle of the night to be closer to the island… and eventually landed on Tuesday afternoon!

I have never left the three of them and it was VERY HARD!!

It was so hard on all of us! Max sent me a text that said it was “the longest day of his life.”

Hated being away from them!

Our luggage didn’t arrive on Nantucket when we did. So lunch it was!

The Cru lobster roll has been one of my favorite lobster rolls since 2013 when I first had it.

Everything else is delish too!

I am team warm lobster roll every day.

All worth it!

Praise that our luggage showed up at the actual 11th hour before the book event!

White Elephant at night is dreamy.

We had so many delicious meals! Starting at The Nautilus.

Just as dreamy in real life.

It has been AGES since I had a smoothie bowl but this was so good… probably because it was steamy as heck with 1% humidity!

This signing was amazing… Elin’s fans are incredible and line up for hours ahead of time.

Dinner later was wok fried lobster! Ahhhh.

I adore Nantucket because it is just so charming. I have forever. If only it didn’t cost a bajillion dollars to live there!

My suitcase got the memo to match the hydrangeas. It’s the BEIS berry.

After no sleep for almost 48 hours to start the trip, it was hard to recover. We had a great time but I still can’t get over that we lost an entire 1.5 days, our place for the night and all of our plans! Needless to say I was excited to get home.

Favorite preschooler in his 90s gear.

Matching for cross country!

So fun.

And a little walk in the sun later that evening.

Had to make a good dinner today! All the caramelized onions.

Classic summer love.

My lettuce wrap burgers, roasted broccoli, caprese and chive grilled potatoes! Yum yum.
